result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott C Harvey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in the amount of $17,250.00 and restitution surcharge. 
-------------------------------
**AMENDMENT 11-29-2016 - PURSUANT TO RESTITUTION HEARING HELD ON 11-04-2016 AND BY ORDER OF THE COURT ADOPTING FINDINGS OF FACT, the Defendant shall pay restitution to Paragon Subrogation Services in the amount of $10.156.16, and restitution to Christine Phillips in the amount of $5048.54 for a total obligation of $15,204.70 and restitution surcharges. The Court further finds that the Defendant has the ability to pay the full amount of restitution unless otherwise ordered by the Court.
-------------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
-------------------------------

Maintain full time work or school or a combination of the two. 
-------------------------------

Not to possess or consume alcohol, drugs or drug paraphernalia. No contact with victims.
-------------------------------

Participate in any other counseling as recommended by Probation Agent including going back to former counselor if appropriate.    Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
-------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
-------------------------------

Pay court costs.     If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
-------------------------------

timeConds.notes: with work release privileges to commence forthwith.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay restitution  as determined from Order adopting Findings of Fact and Conclusions of Law Filed 11/23/2016. in the amount of $10,156.16 to Paragon Subrogation Services and $5,084.54 to C.P., less any payments paid while on probation. Per balance summary from DOC payments in the amount of $96.80 have been made towards restitution and have been adjusted and will reflect on Assessment Report. 
------------------------------------

Pay court costs.   If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
COC COLLECT
------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------

records.addlTxt: Temporary Commitment form filed
BOND QUASHED

9:01 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Atty Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deft Scott C Harvey in court, in custody with Atty Rebecca Hammock.  
Matter is before the Court for sentencing.  
Court recites charge and maximum potential penalties.  
Court has reviewed the contents of the file, including the victim impact statement and the restitution request.  
Court has also reviewed the sentencing memorandum filed by Atty Hammock.  
9:03 am  Statement by Christine Phillips, victim.  
9:17 am  Statement by John Lowery, victim.  
9:20 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty Herrmann.  
9:26 am  Response by Atty Hammock that they are in agreement with the State's recommendation as to sentence.    
9:26 am  Court asks if the letters contained within the Defense sentencing memorandum were provided to the victims?  
9:27 am  Court would like those letters provided to victims to read here in court.  
9:27 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty Hammock.  
9:29 am  Statement by the defendant.  
9:30 am  Response by defendant to Court's questions.  
9:35 am  Court proceeds with making its record and sentences the defendant.  

SENTENCE:  
Withheld sentence - 4 yrs probation;  
139 days of dead time credit IF REVOKED 

1)  Ninety (90) days in the WCJ with work release privileges to commence forthwith (09/07/2016).  
2)  Undergo an AODA assessment and follow through with any recommendations.  
3)  Participate in any other counseling recommended by Agent including going back to former counselor if appropriate.  
4)  Pay restitution in the amount of $17,250.00.  
5)  Pay court costs and DOC supervision fees.  
6)  Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  
7)  Not to possess or consume alcohol, drugs or drug paraphernalia  No weapons.  
8)  No contact with victims.  
9)  Maintain full time work or school or a combination of the two.  

Court gives warnings as to firearms restriction and voter ineligibility.  
9:50 am  Court in recess.

Defendant Scott C Harvey in court, in custody with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 7, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Application for Jail Time Credit form
*Corrected Application for Jail Time Credit form

Defendant Scott Harvey present in court, in custody via video with attorney Travis Schwantes. Matthew Surridge appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Schwantes withdraws his bond motion at this time. Minutes filed.
Defendant's Moiton to Modify Conditions of Release
Signed bond filed with the court.

DEFENDANT MUST CONTINUE TREATMENT WITH WILL ARREOLA
Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH C.P., J.L. OR M.W.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
